alert.note: Alert for Inland Georgetown (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 6:43PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Georgetown and southwestern Williamsburg Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 642 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gourdin, or 14 miles south of Kingstree, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lambert, Gourdin and Lane. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
